reviews.text: I love the idea, but there are few historic plaques/markers and nearly all the buildings are private. There is very little tour literature. With a little bit of improvement, this could be a really good learning experience.
A nice little walk (about 45 minutes) to make on a sunny day. Download the audio book ($1.20) beforehand so you can hear the stories behind the places you visit.
Worth a stroll so much to learn about in this City. Walk and learn

Very interesting history and nice walk through a beautiful neighborhood.  Cool to see one the first public schools for african americans in the counrty.  Note the sights arent all marked.... finding them required some persistence and googling.
Best light post I've ever seen I don't. Know how it doesn't turn off

That is MIT Museum it a rare place with days of activities and exhibits to explore and learn. I would recommend taking two visits to take in all the extraordinary historical finds and nature. The science of the earth is amazing to see all the theories. A family could spend all day here . So maybe come early, take a break for a meal and then explore the rest of the place or just plan two visits to be able to enjoy each educational exhibit fully. Most of the exhibits are interactive and fun for all ages.

Mind blowing collection of scientifically, technological, art stuff.

Generally takes 2-3 hours to absorb the place completely. If I remember it right, entry is 50% discounted for folks in college right now, for general crowd it is $10

Sharing a few videos to give a taste of gestural engineering projects shared on first floor during Aug 2018

MIT Museum it a rare place with days of activities and exhibits to explore and learn. I would recommend taking two visits to take in all the extraordinary historical finds and nature. The science of the earth is amazing to see all the theories. A family could spend all day here . So maybe come early, take a break for a meal and then explore the rest of the place or just plan two visits to be able to enjoy each educational exhibit fully. Most of the exhibits are interactive and fun for all ages.

It was a cool place. The exhibits could have been better or more interesting but it was a cool experience. No food or drinks allowed, so don't bring your coffee unless you want to leave it at the front desk

Very enjoyed the museum! Despite the name, it’s not really though an MIT Museum (it has little of MIT’s history per se), but more like a museum of technology that came out of it. It’s a great spot to come alone (it’s not so large) or with friends and family, and there are some interactive activities that children can also participate (at specific hours).

An amazing adventure for adults and kids. World-class taxidermy. Awesome mineral collection. Incredible fossils. Informative rotating exhibits. Friendly and helpful staff. It's easy to forget that the glass flowers are made out of glass. I've been there 10 or more times and still don't feel like I've seen everything.

I loved it! There's so much to see. Me and my kids agree this was more enjoyable than the Boston Museum of science. It's compact so we got to see a lot without walking a marathon. The dinosaurs were stunning too!

One of the best collections the humanity has stored. An astonishing travel to the past of the history and the past of your childhood.

The museum is divided into two parts, left and right arms. In order to have enough time you will need one hour for any of them.

I stopped here by chance on my way through Boston. It is truly a well put together and fascinating place! They have an extensive collection of artifacts, taxidermy animals, insects, plants, fossils and more! It was well worth the time and money spent!

Lots of great exhibits. Definitely worth spending half a day (or maybe even a whole day) here taking everything in! Don't expect a museum like the Museum of Natural History or the Field Museum - this museum feels more approachable and familiar which results in a more engaging and interactive feeling.

This place, including the adjacent natural history museum, is one of the best museums in the country. The 5 hours we spent were not nearly enough! There is so much to learn and see, and the collection is presented so beautifully that you actually want to spend time reading it all. I kept wishing that I lived in Boston, just so I could go there every week and take the time to really absorb everything and appreciate what Harvard has done here. Expect random school children groups to come through (who don't understand what they have and we don't 🙁) and distract you.
Many fantastic exhibits and historical accounts. Great range of artifacts on display accurately recounting the cultures of yesteryear.

This museum was one of my favorite places during our Boston vacation. The museum has many great things to see. We got there an hour before closing but we managed to see everything and enjoy them. If you're close by give it a try. Highly recommended.
Great little cultural museum connected with the Harvard Museum of Natural History (entrance to one is good for the other). Free to Massachusetts residents with ID Sundays before noon.

Expected a huge collection, but so far whatever is located is quite unique but dims in front of the Museum of Fine arts collection. This is definitely a recommended museum for all the collection and educative information the exhibits carry.

So this museum is pretty huge, way bigger than I had expected because of the multiple levels. They have a wide variety of art do you should definitely be able to find something that you like. The weird thing about this place was that you could get coffee right by the entrance to one of the rooms, but still inside the building, and there are no signs saying that you should not take the drinks into the gallery. So my wife and I were yelled at after a few minutes of being in the gallery. In hindsight it should have been fairly obvious that it's not allowed, but I would definitely suggest signs, especially because of the close proximity of the coffee area to one of the rooms in the gallery.

Excellent collection located at one of the world's foremost institutions. Comfortable place to work and study, unique selection of artifacts from throughout their archives - including a rare selection of pigments. A bit small in scope, however, relative to the university's collections.

Excellent collection located at one of the world's foremost institutions. Comfortable place to work and study, unique selection of artifacts from throughout their archives - including a rare selection of pigments. A bit small in scope, however, relative to the university's collections.

After 10 years of planning and 6 years of construction, the Harvard Art Museum was finally reopened in the late fall of 2014. The two-storey exhibition hall, which cost $350 million, brings together all the treasures of the previous three museums. Designed by Renzo Piano, the new pavilion moves the original Art Research Center from the first floor to the top floor, and is equipped with new art restoration and maintenance equipment. The Art Research Center, which is open to visitors, is a major feature of the Harvard Art Museum. Visitors can enjoy some precious original works and have a close look at the experience.

Went to two Erasmus lectures in the auditorium -- a great place to look and listen but not so much for note-taking if you're so inclined. Seats are comfy and legroom ample -- they often screen films here. Parking is free in the Broadway Garage (off Felton St.) when the museum hosts special events!
Great free rotating exhibit art gallery with rotating exhibits
Super yummy, cheap. I used to be a vegetarian, there veggies options are not so hot.  Meaty options yum.

Things to consider when eating at Anna's...

1) What does "fitness" really mean anyways?

2) Moving to be closer to a Taqueria isn't as sad as it sounds in your head.

3) When someone says "this is good but have you tried _____" you know they're not to be trusted.

4) After eating here a $30 Doordash / UberEats order for a single burrito and a Mexican Coke becomes strangely acceptable. 

5) How quickly you get over the embarrassment of ordering a super super burrito.

I'm sure someone enjoys burritos that are primarily composed of bland rice and store bought chips, but I was disappointed. I've heard a number of folks recommend Anna's, so I've gone a couple time in case the first was a fluke (and I miss mexican food). Nope, it's terrible. Comically bad customer service too.
Cheap but tasty food. Usually fast service
Best place to get your Mexican fix . fresh food great quality

This is my go-to place if I feel too lazy to get ready and go out for dinner. Service is very quick, I really like their Alfredo sauce pasta and gyro diner. At a point I was so addicted to the gyro dinner, that I used to have it twice a week! Pizzas can be a little disappointing sometimes though. But overall a good place to hangout and quick bite.
Great neighborhood pizza shop. Good shawarma too
I find the crust just a bit cardboard like, however the cheese was augmented with some slices instead of just shredded so overall the impression was decent. Cheap too so basically cannot be beat.
Super friendly service.  Yummy food.  Fresh ingredients including homeade pita.

Very friendly service and enjoyed the food!
I would go back
I hope they never go out of business. Love the authentic American-Chinese cuisine, without extra oil and soy... I find the menu light and healthy.

I love the Saturday & Sunday dim sum at Mary Chung's. I've been all over (NYC, San Fransisco, Boston Chinatown, etc.) and Mary Chung's is The Best Dim Sum. First time? Try these dishes: Peking Ravioli steamed, Small Steamer Buns (delicate pork dumplings), Taiwan Style Rice Noodles with Pork & Vegetables, Grandma's Pie, Dun Dun Noodles with chicken (very spicy).
I tried the Xian long bao (Soup dumplings), Shu mai, and the shrimp dumplings. This was far from authentic. I would not recommend it. I love fusion food, but this simply was only worth one star.
Famous, local favorite Sichuan restaurant always serves fragrant, tasty food.
I like the Suan la Chow Show (spicy pork dumpling) I also like the rice noodles & singapore style rice noodles

Great food, really good buffalo wings. Beer selection is really nice. Burgers are delicious!  

The bar can fill up quickly, there's usually several people seated when I've been there but I still haven't had an issue.

In terms of service everyone has a positive demeanor and the bartenders are really good at checking up on you. I will definitely be coming back!

Cool menu. Good beer and cocktail selection. Service was friendly and quick. The atmosphere was exceptionally "cambridge" if you know what I mean. We got there after 6:30, sat with no wait, and made it to a show in the city before 8.

Christopher's is very conveniently located in Porter square, and has a great variety of beers on tap. They make an awesome veggie burger, and I'm a huge fan of their french fries. I appreciated that they seated us quickly, and will definitely be back!

I usually go to this place during the week to share a story and a beer with who ever but I like the place. It is very comfortable and not to loud. I would probably suggest bringing a date for a casual meal or a few drinks. Only had food a few times but I was impressed with the meal. As for the weekend night I don't know how it is.

Nice outdoor seating on the first beautiful day of the year. Wait staff was friendly, attentive . Bloody Mary's rocked ! 
I had the 1920's burger cooked medium and it was done to perfection. .

Small but intimate spot. Food was pretty decent and not super expensive. Mulled wine and cider was amazing. The reason for the 5 stars was that our waitress was SO attentive and friendly. Great time overall!

You can get fantastic cocktails for only $8 here! Plus the atmosphere is very laid back/ cozy. You seat yourself, which is nice. And it was super easy to get a table on a Friday night. We got the Grendel sandwich and would for sure get that again!

Great nachos and a solid burger. They don't serve fries which is a bummer as they go so well with the burger. We were there on a Sunday so I don't know much about parking. The place is less than 5 minutes from the Harvard University T stop.
Great place for a nice quiet lunch. Great vibes in the evening as well when things pick up. Good value, good food, good beers.

Visited this place during a food tour. Seems like a really cool bar and place to meet up with friends or family, with a nice atmosphere. We tried the deviled eggs during the tour, but I would definitely come back to try other things or get some drinks.

Very nice place. There is extra seating in a separate room. The owner is nice enough to let us use it as a ukulele meeting place so we play music here every other Monday. 

The ice cream is delicious and they always give you a good bit. Their small is actually still quite large. 

It's a nice place to sit and chat and have an ice cream or some tea with someone.

Glass dishes, metal spoons, and free ice water in real glasses may not matter much to some, but after eating ice cream all day out of disposable bowls with sometimes serrated plastic spoons, Lizzy's was a very welcomed stop. A more refined ice cream shop of yore, this Waltham institution produces blue-ribbon ice cream in all the usual flavors, including a few surprises, like Cantaloupe or Charles River Crunch. Lizzy's also boasts a take-out shop in Harvard Square.
Very good ice cream and yummy toppings. Super kid friendly but also a good spot for college students to get a late night lick🍁🍃

Went for a birthday party. Staff was nice. Looked around for an outlet to charge my phone. Looked behind the fridge on the floor in the party room, saw a glue mice trap with 2 dead mice or more, looked away before I could count. Please check your traps.
Best ice cream in Waltham! Don't be discouraged if there is a long line. It goes by really fast and is worth the wait.

I was looking for a place to see some live music while visiting Boston. I came across The Middle East. I checked out the reviews. I was pleased with what I saw. A quick trip across the bridge and we were there. We had a nice and reasonably priced dinner. Then it was onto the Upstairs for our concert. It was a small crowd and a small venue and that was exactly what I wanted. Up close and personal with each of the bands. Loved it.

Went here to see my friend play live. Middle East has "sections" of its' venue. I was in the "corner" venue; great little spot for intimate live performances. The drinks were really good and mixed well; I ordered Jameson-Gingers and had no problems. 

Seating is also great, but if you're going there for a performance, they clear part of the floor to stand or dance. There's still places to sit and plenty of space to dance with your friends as it wasn't super crowded. Definitely recommend for a night out. The atmosphere is what you'd expect; right on the corner of Mass Ave; great people watching. 

They have a great-looking menu which I haven't tried just yet. Overall, drinks, sound and service were excellent. Only reason I haven't presented 5 stars yet is because I haven't tried their food!

It is a pretty good venue, I have been to shows both in the downstairs and upstairs. One they should do is improve the sound systems, the house PA systems are getting really old and should be replaced with modern great sounding equipment. Both shows I went to had pretty terrible sound and not because they weren't mixed well.

Great cheap food in an old and austere room. Awesome service and general staff.  It was a very hipster vibe, suitable for Central Square. I had lamb shank with couscous, which was amazing. The multiple music venues (we went for an event) are fun and lively.  God bless the owner for his many years of friendly service the the community.

Review is for Sonia.  As you might assume, this place is kind of grungy.  But so fun!!!  Came here for a sold out show and while it was really packed, it wasn't unreasonably so.  Kudos for putting out a self-serve water station.  Coat check was not too painful.  No big lines out the door.  Good sound system.  I don't know.  I kind of liked it.

Refreshingly unique (authentic?) taste sets Picante apart from the big Mexican and quasi-Mexican chains. You've got to order at the counter instead of getting table service, but at least you can wash down your chips and salsa with a Dos Equis.
Ignore the big burrito chains and head for this neighborhood tortilla joint.  The freshest ingredients and everything is tasty and delicious.  Don't miss the salsa bar and fresh limeade!
THe burritos are awesome. This small hole-in-the-wall in place always hits the spot. Nothing like a steak burrito to get you through the day.

The food is great. is really different from any other restaurant in boston. The only thing I would change about the place is their customer service. The cashiers that I've had seem to hate their job there. They on limit themselves to get your order and charge instead of offer you options or suggest other things to try.

A great local Mexican take-out or eat-in location.  They serve up big taco salads with a tasty fresh-made taco shell dish, and the guac is oh so yummy.  They offer a salsa bar that allows customers to pick and choose salsas to accompany their meals - the chipotle is without a doubt one to try!

Decrepit af. Bathroom is nightmare fuel and Everytime I needed to use it I swear the same homeless lady is in there, almost like she lives there? I am homeless too, but I still have some dignity lol No I do not have 50 cents btw. 

Neat underground, tho. Pics related.

This is a large subway station on the MBTA "red line" which doubles as a commuter rail stop. It is fairly dirty and I always see homeless people smoking inside. There has been a major leak running 24 hours for at least 5 or 6 years onto one of the tracks, so the entire wall is rusted. I hope the whoever is asleep at the wheel at the MBTA will wake up and fix this before a wall collapses on us.
Excellently located T stop, although the escalator ride up to the ground-level is comically long.
I walked from here to Brigham circle once just to see how long it would take. Good thing I bought dry socks at city sports when I was in the Square, lol. Loved it back then, and now....
You would need a good seven minutes to exit the station or make it down  to the trains due to the long staircases

Love Toscanini's. Their ice cream is so delicious and they make amazing ice cream birthdays cakes that are served with hot fudge. If you're unsure about what flavor you want for a birthday cake feel free to stop and and sample as many flavors as you want.

My favorite flavors for cakes are cookies and cream, cookie dough, Heath, peanut butter cup, butter almond and B3 is pretty good well.

If the quote on the front window ("The best ice cream in the world" –New York Times) isn't enough to draw you in, Toscanini's line of inventive flavors should do the trick. Routinely, a third of the menu requires translation and perhaps a sample or two to put your curiosity to rest. Regardless of the flavor, however, all of the ice cream is decadently creamy and pillowy soft, almost necessitating the use of a dish in lieu of a cone.

Excellent place for ice creams. Very unique flavors but the taste is amazing! I tried the Vienna Finger cookie and it was good. They have options of hot fudge or butterscotch syrup to top your ice cream and some usual toppings. If you love ice creams, definitely don't miss this place.
Very nice place . I like their ice cream options and also the staff. They have the best customer service. Also think the place is very cozy

Best ice cream in Cambridge (and Boston) hands down. I've been here more times than I care to admit and have had more flavors than I can even list and not once have I ever been disappointed!

They're very creative with their flavors and they'll give you samples if you ask or you're not sure what you want. I love that they do a microscoop too! Perfect size for when you're not hungry but still NEED ice cream (although let's admit it... you know you want the bigger size).

The line can get long in the summer, but it's worth the wait.

Part 3 of Oscar and Jesse eat their way through Central Square.  We ordered a burger, veggie burger and veggie chili. The food was good especially the fries. Veggie burger was of the grain kind but melded well with the condiments (guest reviewer Z approved).  Greet beer selection. Chocolate cake big enough for 3.

Boys say: interesting atmosphere.  Early industrial meets medieval Ireland. Like a comic book.  Very spacious. We felt at ease.

Good sized meals and excellent cocktails. I had the chocolate martini and I’m normally not one to order a second, but I did here! Our server was very polite and helpful when she found out we were from out of town

Maybe it's good for drinks. Slow service and dumped the dish on the table and no cutlery to be seen; I had to snatch it from a table nearby... Of course, they asked for a tip, which you better pay in case you have to come back. Hopefully not.
Best place to have a big group. Or a small group! Such q great spot to just kick back and relax.
We had food and drinks mid- to late-afternoon; would go again. The bartenders are knowledgeable and enthusiastic. Would recommend for drinks as well
Nice cozy place to sit down with a few friends and enjoy some unique Neapolitan style pizzas. The unconventional flavors set this pizzeria apart from others. The service was also great.
Best pizza in Boston! Go for the specialty pizza, especially the one called People's Republic. Salads are also really good.
Great slices. Good sauce. Didn't leave you with that heavy feeling some places that do slices do.

The Boston (south end) extension to the well known and popular Emma's in Cambridge is small and more suitable for take out, but when the weather is nice there are outside tables. I can't help but visit at least once a week for lunch of a couple of their delicious, crispy thin crust slices or one of their sandwiches. My favorite is the muffuletta.

I am so excited they decided to open a second shop. I make a stop here on my way home from work at least once a week. By far the best pizza I have had in the South End! Pugh's Corner is my favorite so far, but I am working my way through the menu and will report back with any new findings!

This is a hidden brunch gem, which is surprising because everyone I know at MIT knows of this place. We were turned off by the ridiculous wait at veggie galaxy for Sunday brunch, came here to no wait, and a delicious, vegetarian brunch selection.
Great place to chill and grab a quick beer in Central Square. Tim is a great bartender!
Great place for music and the staff are great as well . Just saw the group called Milkk great new artist. A+++

Good food, and amazing portions for brunch. It's a really nice place to go if you are in the mood for leisurely brunch with unlimited coffee refills and no one waiting in line making you feel like you should hurry. The Huevos Rancheros is my go-to!

Great place to catch up with friends, friendly and mostly quiet atmosphere until it switches over to a club after 10pm on Fridays and weekends. Food is okay but nothing worth writing home about. If you like cocktails, do try the Dutch raspberry lemonade!

Awesome place for dinner! So many potential meals you can put together here.  They've got something for everyone.  It was pretty busy both times I've been here so definitely make reservations ahead of time to make sure you can get a table when you want one and aren't stuck waiting.  Nice staff and friendly cooks.  I'll definitely be back again.

Best experience ever! Choosing your meat and making the cook grill it live in front of you.. love it! The waitress was prompt and polite. After my meal, I was knocked into a food coma. Everything was simply decadent. The decor was unique and incredible. 5 stars!

Being able to customize your meal was great. The choices were great. The outcome of it all was okay. I would go back but I would have to be super hungry. It is All You Can Eat, so try not to make the same mistake as me and fill your bowl with 1meal. I had a taste of the pasta which was okay. The veggie options were great. Chocolate cake was mediocre. Reason being: it was one of those cakes that defrosted out of the box and has a hard ganache finish. (not really my thing). Otherwise, a fun experience and great music. Nice atmosphere and fairly fast.

Not bad. Buffet style restaurant. Went with wife and 3 kids. Was there about 2 1/2 hours. They had some pasta, rice, muscles, salmon, chicken, hamburgers, hot dogs, and salad stuff. Then if you want it cooked, you get in line. Depending on how many people are there, could be done right away, or so long it may burn a little. Also depends on how many people are working the skillet.

A restaurant you must try at least once - or perhaps several times. The novelty of crafting your own dish is enjoyable, as is watching the entertaining chefs cook it in front of you. Bubbly, louder atmosphere. In all, quite a fun place.

Everything on the eclectic menu is delicious. The seats are a little too close together but the food is worth it. During warmer months, the outside patio is cozy and wonderful and offers more privacy. This is no drop in place so be sure to make reservations. Pricey but worth it to taste things you probably have never tried. Good for date night not a group of friends who would also be drinking.

Simply one of the best restaurants I have ever eaten at. Setup for mainly tapas but a very delicious of Greek, Turkish, and Mediterranean food all mixed together. They also have a great selection of wine and their cocktails are fantastic as well.

Fantastic food in a great atmosphere. Dinner is in the small plates style (think tapas), each one unique and delicious. Great wait staff. 

Try the moussaka and the sultan's dish, beef short rib, and the baked Alaska dessert was phenomenal.

Oleana provided for such a wonderful culinary experience! Our server had great recommendations and guided us to interestingly spiced fettah, a great twist on hummus, and of course, the baked Alaska. Just about everyone in the restaurant ordered it, which is probably why everyone was leaving so happy.

The food here is fantastic. They serve meze style plates which is always fun because you get to try so many different things. The group of 4 of us got a bunch of different plates to share and every single one was amazing!
